com.nhn.android.maps

Class NMapView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • com.nhn.android.maps.NMapView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent

    public class NMapView
extends android.view.ViewGroup
    A View which displays a map (with data obtained from the Naver Maps service). When focused, it will capture keypresses and touch gestures to pan and zoom the map. It can also be controlled programmatically and can draw a number of Overlays on top of the map. The preferred zoom mechanism is the built-in zoom, see setBuiltInZoomControls(boolean). As the user pans the map, zoom controls will automatically be shown at the bottom of the NMapView. The NMapView is also a ViewGroup, with LayoutParameters allowing you to attach views either to a specific pixel offset, or to a specific latitude/longitude pair. A NMapView can only be constructed (or inflated) by a NMapActivity. This is because it depends on threads which access the network and file system in the background; Note. NMapView requires following permissions in the manifest file of your application. - android.permission.INTERNET

      • setClipBounds

        public void setClipBounds(int left,
                          int top,
                          int right,
                          int bottom)
        Set the bounds which is clip area of the NMapView. By default it is equal to the bounds of NMapView with origin at the upper left corner.
        Parameters:
        left - upper left coordinate of the view frame relative to the NMapView.
        top - upper top coordinate of the view frame relative to the NMapView.
        right - lower right coordinate of the view frame relative to the NMapView.
        bottom - lower bottom coordinate of the view frame relative to the NMapView.

      • getClipBounds

        public android.graphics.Rect getClipBounds()
        Get the bounds which is clipping area of the NMapView.
        Overrides:
        getClipBounds in class android.view.View
        Returns:
        visible bounds of the NMapView and it is relative to the upper left corner of the NMapView.

      • setBuiltInZoomControls

        public void setBuiltInZoomControls(boolean on,
                                   NMapView.LayoutParams lp)
        Sets whether to enable the built-in zoom controls. If enabled, the NMapView will show these zoom controls automatically.
        Parameters:
        on - Whether the built-in zoom controls are enabled. If false, the client handles showing the UI for zoom controls.
        lp - Layout parameters for the built-in zoom controls. If null, default layout parameters are used.
